subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the padding of an empty for initializer; that is whether a white space is required at an empty for initializer, or such white space is forbidden. No check occurs if there is a line wrap at the initializer, as in
subsection.source: for ( ; i < j; i++, j--)

tr.td: Specify policy on how to pad an empty for iterator.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyForInitializerPad"/>
subsection.p: To configure the check to require white space at an empty for iterator:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyForInitializerPad"> <property name="option" value="space"/> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the padding of an empty for iterator; that is whether a white space is required at an empty for iterator, or such white space is forbidden. No check occurs if there is a line wrap at the iterator, as in

tr.td: Specify policy on how to pad an empty for iterator.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyForIteratorPad"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to require white space at an empty for iterator:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyForIteratorPad"> <property name="option" value="space"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks for empty line separators before package, all import declarations, fields, constructors, methods, nested classes, static initializers and instance initializers.
Checks for empty line separators before not only statements but implementation and documentation comments and blocks as well.

ATTENTION: empty line separator is required between token siblings, not after line where token is found. If token does not have a sibling of the same type, then empty line is required at its end (for example for CLASS_DEF it is after '}'). Also, trailing comments are skipped.
ATTENTION: violations from multiple empty lines cannot be suppressed via XPath: #8179.

tr.td: Allow no empty line between fields.
Allow multiple empty lines between class members.
Allow multiple empty lines inside class members.

subset of tokens
PACKAGE_DEF , IMPORT , STATIC_IMPORT , CLASS_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , ENUM_DEF , STATIC_INIT , INSTANCE_INIT , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , VARIABLE_DEF , RECORD_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF .
PACKAGE_DEF , IMPORT , STATIC_IMPORT , CLASS_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , ENUM_DEF , STATIC_INIT , INSTANCE_INIT , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , VARIABLE_DEF , RECORD_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the default check:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"/>
subsection.p: Example of declarations without empty line separator:
Example of declarations with empty line separator that is expected by the Check by default:

To check empty line before
VARIABLE_DEF and
METHOD_DEF:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"> <property name="tokens" value="VARIABLE_DEF, METHOD_DEF"/> </module>
subsection.p: To allow no empty line between fields:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"> <property name="allowNoEmptyLineBetweenFields" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
Example of declarations with multiple empty lines between class members (allowed by default):
To disallow multiple empty lines between class members:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"> <property name="allowMultipleEmptyLines" value="false"/> </module>
subsection.p: To disallow multiple empty lines inside constructor, initialization block and method:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"> <property name="allowMultipleEmptyLinesInsideClassMembers" value="false"/> </module>
subsection.p:
The check is valid only for statements that have body:
CLASS_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , ENUM_DEF , STATIC_INIT , INSTANCE_INIT , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF .
Example of declarations with multiple empty lines inside method:
To disallow multiple empty lines between class members:
subsection.source: <module name="EmptyLineSeparator"> <property name="allowMultipleEmptyLines" value="false"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that there are no tab characters ('\t') in the source code.
Rationale:

ul.li: Developers should not need to configure the tab width of their text editors in order to be able to read source code.
From the Apache jakarta coding standards: In a distributed development environment, when the commit messages get sent to a mailing list, they are almost impossible to read if you use tabs.

tr.td: Control whether to report on each line containing a tab, or just the first instance.
Specify file type extension of files to process.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to report only the first instance in each file:
subsection.source: <module name="FileTabCharacter"/>
subsection.p: Example - Test.java:
To configure the check to report each instance in each file:
subsection.source: <module name="FileTabCharacter"> <property name="eachLine" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example - Test.java:
To configure the check to report instances on only certain file types:
subsection.source: <module name="FileTabCharacter"> <property name="fileExtensions" value="java, xml"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example - Test.java:
Example - Test.xml:
subsection.source: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?> <UserAccount> <FirstName>John</FirstName> <!-- violation, indented using tab --> <LastName>Doe</LastName> <!-- only first occurrence in file reported --> </UserAccount>
subsection.p: Example - Test.html:
subsection.source: This is a simple html document.

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that the whitespace around the Generic tokens (angle brackets) "<" and ">" are correct to the typical convention. The convention is not configurable.
Left angle bracket ("<"):

ul.li: should be preceded with whitespace only in generic methods definitions.
should not be preceded with whitespace when it is preceded method name or constructor.
should not be preceded with whitespace when following type name.
should not be followed with whitespace in all cases.

subsection.p: Right angle bracket (">"):

ul.li: should not be preceded with whitespace in all cases.
should be followed with whitespace in almost all cases, except diamond operators and when preceding method name or constructor.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="GenericWhitespace"/>
subsection.p: Examples with correct spacing:
Examples with incorrect spacing:

div.pre:
List< String> l; // violation, "<" followed by whitespace Box b = Box. <String>of("foo"); // violation, "<" preceded with whitespace public<T> void foo() {} // violation, "<" not preceded with whitespace
List a = new ArrayList<> (); // violation, ">" followed by whitespace Map<Integer, String>m; // violation, ">" not followed by whitespace Pair<Integer, Integer > p; // violation, ">" preceded with whitespace

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the padding between the identifier of a method definition, constructor definition, method call, or constructor invocation; and the left parenthesis of the parameter list. That is, if the identifier and left parenthesis are on the same line, checks whether a space is required immediately after the identifier or such a space is forbidden. If they are not on the same line, reports a violation, unless configured to allow line breaks. To allow linebreaks after the identifier, set property allowLineBreaks to true.

tr.td: Allow a line break between the identifier and left parenthesis.
Specify policy on how to pad method parameter.

subset of tokens
CTOR_DEF , LITERAL_NEW , METHOD_CALL , METHOD_DEF , SUPER_CTOR_CALL , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , RECORD_DEF .
CTOR_DEF , LITERAL_NEW , METHOD_CALL , METHOD_DEF , SUPER_CTOR_CALL , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , RECORD_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="MethodParamPad"/>
subsection.p: To configure the check to require a space after the identifier of a method definition, except if the left parenthesis occurs on a new line:
subsection.source: <module name="MethodParamPad"> <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_DEF"/> <property name="option" value="space"/> <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that chosen statements are not line-wrapped. By default, this Check restricts wrapping import and package statements, but it's possible to check any statement.

tr.td:
subset of tokens
IMPORT , STATIC_IMPORT , PACKAGE_DEF , CLASS_DEF , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , ENUM_DEF , INTERFACE_DEF , RECORD_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to force no line-wrapping in package and import statements (default values):
subsection.source: <module name="NoLineWrap"/>
subsection.p: Examples of line-wrapped statements (bad case):
Examples:
To configure the check to force no line-wrapping only in import statements:
subsection.source: <module name="NoLineWrap"> <property name="tokens" value="IMPORT"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to force no line-wrapping only in class, method and constructor definitions:
subsection.source: <module name="NoLineWrap"> <property name="tokens" value="CLASS_DEF, METHOD_DEF, CTOR_DEF"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
Examples of not line-wrapped statements (good case):
subsection.source: import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck; import static java.math.BigInteger.ZERO;

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that there is no whitespace after a token. More specifically, it checks that it is not followed by whitespace, or (if linebreaks are allowed) all characters on the line after are whitespace. To forbid linebreaks after a token, set property allowLineBreaks to false.

The check processes
ARRAY_DECLARATOR and INDEX_OP tokens specially from other tokens. Actually it is checked that there is no whitespace before these tokens, not after them. Space after the
ANNOTATIONS before
ARRAY_DECLARATOR and
INDEX_OP will be ignored.

tr.td: Control whether whitespace is allowed if the token is at a linebreak.

subset of tokens
ARRAY_INIT , AT , INC , DEC , UNARY_MINUS , UNARY_PLUS , BNOT , LNOT , DOT , TYPECAST , ARRAY_DECLARATOR , INDEX_OP , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , METHOD_REF .
ARRAY_INIT , AT , INC , DEC , UNARY_MINUS , UNARY_PLUS , BNOT , LNOT , DOT , ARRAY_DECLARATOR , INDEX_OP .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceAfter"/>
subsection.p: To configure the check to forbid linebreaks after a DOT token:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceAfter"> <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/> <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="false"/> </module>
subsection.p: If the annotation is between the type and the array, the check will skip validation for spaces:
subsection.source: public void foo(final char @NotNull [] param) {} // No violation

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that there is no whitespace before a token. More specifically, it checks that it is not preceded with whitespace, or (if linebreaks are allowed) all characters on the line before are whitespace. To allow linebreaks before a token, set property allowLineBreaks to true. No check occurs before semicolons in empty for loop initializers or conditions.

tr.td: Control whether whitespace is allowed if the token is at a linebreak.

subset of tokens
COMMA , SEMI , POST_INC , POST_DEC , DOT , GENERIC_START , GENERIC_END , ELLIPSIS , LABELED_STAT , METHOD_REF .
COMMA , SEMI , POST_INC , POST_DEC , ELLIPSIS , LABELED_STAT .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow linebreaks before default tokens:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"> <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: int[][] array = { { 1, 2 } , { 3, 4 } }; // OK, linebreak is allowed before ',' int[][] array2 = { { 1, 2 }, { 3, 4 } }; // OK, ideal code void ellipsisExample(String ...params) {}; // violation, whitespace before '...' is not allowed void ellipsisExample2(String ...params) {}; //OK, linebreak is allowed before '...' Lists.charactersOf("foo") .listIterator() .forEachRemaining(System.out::print); // OK
subsection.p: To Configure the check to restrict the use of whitespace before METHOD_REF and DOT tokens:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"> <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/> <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: Lists.charactersOf("foo").listIterator() .forEachRemaining(System.out::print); // violation, whitespace before '.' is not allowed Lists.charactersOf("foo").listIterator().forEachRemaining(System.out ::print); // violation, // whitespace before '::' is not allowed ^ Lists.charactersOf("foo").listIterator().forEachRemaining(System.out::print); // OK
subsection.p: To configure the check to allow linebreak before METHOD_REF and DOT tokens:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"> <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/> <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/> <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: Lists .charactersOf("foo") //violation, whitespace before '.' is not allowed .listIterator() .forEachRemaining(System.out ::print); // violation, // ^ whitespace before '::' is not allowed Lists.charactersOf("foo") .listIterator() .forEachRemaining(System.out::print); // OK

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that there is no whitespace before the colon in a switch block.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="NoWhitespaceBeforeCaseDefaultColon"/>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the policy on how to wrap lines on operators.

tr.td: Specify policy on how to wrap lines.

subset of tokens
QUESTION , COLON , EQUAL , NOT_EQUAL , DIV , PLUS , MINUS , STAR , MOD , SR , BSR , GE , GT , SL , LE , LT , BXOR , BOR , LOR , BAND , LAND , LITERAL_INSTANCEOF , TYPE_EXTENSION_AND , ASSIGN , DIV_ASSIGN , PLUS_ASSIGN , MINUS_ASSIGN , STAR_ASSIGN , MOD_ASSIGN , SR_ASSIGN , BSR_ASSIGN , SL_ASSIGN , BXOR_ASSIGN , BOR_ASSIGN , BAND_ASSIGN , METHOD_REF .
QUESTION , COLON , EQUAL , NOT_EQUAL , DIV , PLUS , MINUS , STAR , MOD , SR , BSR , GE , GT , SL , LE , LT , BXOR , BOR , LOR , BAND , LAND , TYPE_EXTENSION_AND , LITERAL_INSTANCEOF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="OperatorWrap"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check for assignment operators at the end of a line:
subsection.source: <module name="OperatorWrap"> <property name="tokens" value="ASSIGN,DIV_ASSIGN,PLUS_ASSIGN,MINUS_ASSIGN,STAR_ASSIGN,MOD_ASSIGN, SR_ASSIGN,BSR_ASSIGN,SL_ASSIGN,BXOR_ASSIGN,BOR_ASSIGN,BAND_ASSIGN"/> <property name="option" value="eol"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: class Test { public static void main(String[] args) { int b = 10; // violation, '=' should be on previous line int c = 10; // ok b += 10; // violation, '+=' should be on previous line b += 10; // ok c *= 10; // violation, '*=' should be on previous line c *= 10; // ok c -= 5; // violation, '-=' should be on previous line c -= 5; // ok c /= 2; // violation, '/=' should be on previous line c %= 1; // violation, '%=' should be on previous line c >>= 1; // violation, '>>=' should be on previous line c >>>= 1; // violation, '>>>=' should be on previous line } public void myFunction() { c ^= 1; // violation, '^=' should be on previous line c |= 1; // violation, '|=' should be on previous line c &=1 ; // violation, '&=' should be on previous line c <<= 1; // violation, '<<=' should be on previous line } }

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p:
Checks the policy on the padding of parentheses; that is whether a space is required after a left parenthesis and before a right parenthesis, or such spaces are forbidden. No check occurs at the right parenthesis after an empty for iterator, at the left parenthesis before an empty for initialization, or at the right parenthesis of a try-with-resources resource specification where the last resource variable has a trailing semicolon. Use Check EmptyForIteratorPad to validate empty for iterators and
EmptyForInitializerPad to validate empty for initializers. Typecasts are also not checked, as there is
TypecastParenPad to validate them.

tr.td: Specify policy on how to pad parentheses.

subset of tokens
ANNOTATION , ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF , CTOR_CALL , CTOR_DEF , DOT , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , EXPR , LITERAL_CATCH , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_NEW , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_WHILE , METHOD_CALL , METHOD_DEF , QUESTION , RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION , SUPER_CTOR_CALL , LAMBDA , RECORD_DEF .

ANNOTATION , ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF , CTOR_CALL , CTOR_DEF , DOT , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , EXPR , LITERAL_CATCH , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_NEW , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_WHILE , METHOD_CALL , METHOD_DEF , QUESTION , RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION , SUPER_CTOR_CALL , LAMBDA , RECORD_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="ParenPad"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to require spaces for the parentheses of constructor, method, and super constructor calls:
subsection.source: <module name="ParenPad"> <property name="tokens" value="LITERAL_FOR, LITERAL_CATCH, SUPER_CTOR_CALL"/> <property name="option" value="space"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
The following cases are not checked:
subsection.source: for ( ; i < j; i++, j--) // no check after left parenthesis for (Iterator it = xs.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) // no check before right parenthesis try (Closeable resource = acquire(); ) // no check before right parenthesis

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks line wrapping with separators.

tr.td: Specify policy on how to wrap lines.

subset of tokens
DOT , COMMA , SEMI , ELLIPSIS , AT , LPAREN , RPAREN , ARRAY_DECLARATOR , RBRACK , METHOD_REF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="SeparatorWrap"/>
subsection.p: Example:

To configure the check for
METHOD_REF at new line:
subsection.source: <module name="SeparatorWrap"> <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/> <property name="option" value="nl"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check for comma at the new line:
subsection.source: <module name="SeparatorWrap"> <property name="tokens" value="COMMA"/> <property name="option" value="nl"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that non-whitespace characters are separated by no more than one whitespace. Separating characters by tabs or multiple spaces will be reported. Currently, the check doesn't permit horizontal alignment. To inspect whitespaces before and after comments, set the property validateComments to true.
Setting validateComments to false will ignore cases like:

Sometimes, users like to space similar items on different lines to the same column position for easier reading. This feature isn't supported by this check, so both braces in the following case will be reported as violations.
subsection.source: public long toNanos(long d) { return d; } // 2 violations public long toMicros(long d) { return d / (C1 / C0); }

tr.td: Control whether to validate whitespaces surrounding comments.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="SingleSpaceSeparator"/>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: int foo() { // violation, 3 whitespaces return 1; // violation, 2 whitespaces } int fun1() { // OK, 1 whitespace return 3; // OK, 1 whitespace } void fun2() {} // violation, 2 whitespaces
subsection.p: To configure the check so that it validates comments:
subsection.source: <module name="SingleSpaceSeparator"> <property name="validateComments" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the policy on the padding of parentheses for typecasts. That is, whether a space is required after a left parenthesis and before a right parenthesis, or such spaces are forbidden.

tr.td: Specify policy on how to pad parentheses.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="TypecastParenPad"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to require spaces:
subsection.source: <module name="TypecastParenPad"> <property name="option" value="space"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p:
Checks that a token is followed by whitespace, with the exception that it does not check for whitespace after the semicolon of an empty for iterator. Use Check
EmptyForIteratorPad to validate empty for iterators.

tr.td:
subset of tokens
COMMA , SEMI , TYPECAST , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_ELSE , LITERAL_WHILE , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_FINALLY , LITERAL_RETURN , LITERAL_CATCH , DO_WHILE , ELLIPSIS , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_TRY , LAMBDA .

COMMA , SEMI , TYPECAST , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_ELSE , LITERAL_WHILE , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_FINALLY , LITERAL_RETURN , LITERAL_CATCH , DO_WHILE , ELLIPSIS , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_TRY , LAMBDA .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAfter"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check for whitespace only after COMMA and SEMI tokens:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAfter"> <property name="tokens" value="COMMA, SEMI"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that a token is surrounded by whitespace. Empty constructor, method, class, enum, interface, loop bodies (blocks), lambdas of the form
subsection.source: public MyClass() {} // empty constructor public void func() {} // empty method public interface Foo {} // empty interface public class Foo {} // empty class public enum Foo {} // empty enum MyClass c = new MyClass() {}; // empty anonymous class while (i = 1) {} // empty while loop for (int i = 1; i > 1; i++) {} // empty for loop do {} while (i = 1); // empty do-while loop Runnable noop = () -> {}; // empty lambda public @interface Beta {} // empty annotation type
subsection.p: may optionally be exempted from the policy using the allowEmptyMethods, allowEmptyConstructors, allowEmptyTypes, allowEmptyLoops, allowEmptyLambdas and allowEmptyCatches properties.
This check does not flag as violation double brace initialization like:
Parameter allowEmptyCatches allows to suppress violations when token list contains SLIST to check if beginning of block is surrounded by whitespace and catch block is empty, for example:
With this property turned off, this raises violation because the beginning of the catch block (left curly bracket) is not separated from the end of the catch block (right curly bracket).

tr.td: Allow empty class, interface and enum bodies.

Ignore whitespace around colon in
enhanced for loop.

subset of tokens
ASSIGN , ARRAY_INIT , BAND , BAND_ASSIGN , BOR , BOR_ASSIGN , BSR , BSR_ASSIGN , BXOR , BXOR_ASSIGN , COLON , DIV , DIV_ASSIGN , DO_WHILE , EQUAL , GE , GT , LAMBDA , LAND , LCURLY , LE , LITERAL_CATCH , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_ELSE , LITERAL_FINALLY , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_RETURN , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_TRY , LITERAL_WHILE , LOR , LT , MINUS , MINUS_ASSIGN , MOD , MOD_ASSIGN , NOT_EQUAL , PLUS , PLUS_ASSIGN , QUESTION , RCURLY , SL , SLIST , SL_ASSIGN , SR , SR_ASSIGN , STAR , STAR_ASSIGN , LITERAL_ASSERT , TYPE_EXTENSION_AND , WILDCARD_TYPE , GENERIC_START , GENERIC_END , ELLIPSIS .

ASSIGN , BAND , BAND_ASSIGN , BOR , BOR_ASSIGN , BSR , BSR_ASSIGN , BXOR , BXOR_ASSIGN , COLON , DIV , DIV_ASSIGN , DO_WHILE , EQUAL , GE , GT , LAMBDA , LAND , LCURLY , LE , LITERAL_CATCH , LITERAL_DO , LITERAL_ELSE , LITERAL_FINALLY , LITERAL_FOR , LITERAL_IF , LITERAL_RETURN , LITERAL_SWITCH , LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED , LITERAL_TRY , LITERAL_WHILE , LOR , LT , MINUS , MINUS_ASSIGN , MOD , MOD_ASSIGN , NOT_EQUAL , PLUS , PLUS_ASSIGN , QUESTION , RCURLY , SL , SLIST , SL_ASSIGN , SR , SR_ASSIGN , STAR , STAR_ASSIGN , LITERAL_ASSERT , TYPE_EXTENSION_AND .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"/>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check for whitespace only around assignment operators:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="tokens" value="ASSIGN,DIV_ASSIGN,PLUS_ASSIGN,MINUS_ASSIGN,STAR_ASSIGN, MOD_ASSIGN,SR_ASSIGN,BSR_ASSIGN,SL_ASSIGN,BXOR_ASSIGN, BOR_ASSIGN,BAND_ASSIGN"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
subsection.source: class Test { public static void main(String[] args) { int b=10; // violation int c = 10; // ok b+=10; // violation b += 10; // ok c*=10; // violation c *= 10; // ok c-=5; // violation c -= 5; // ok c/=2; // violation c /= 2; // ok c%=1; // violation c %= 1; // ok c>>=1; // violation c >>= 1; // ok c>>>=1; // violation c >>>= 1; // ok } public void myFunction() { c^=1; // violation c ^= 1; // ok c|=1; // violation c |= 1; // ok c&=1; // violation c &= 1; // ok c<<=1; // violation c <<= 1; // ok } }
subsection.p: To configure the check for whitespace only around curly braces:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="tokens" value="LCURLY,RCURLY"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty method bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyMethods" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty constructor bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyConstructors" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty type bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyTypes" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty loop bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyLoops" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty lambda bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyLambdas" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
To configure the check to allow empty catch bodies:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="allowEmptyCatches" value="true"/> </module>
subsection.p: Example:
Also, this check can be configured to ignore the colon in an enhanced for loop. The colon in an enhanced for loop is ignored by default.
To configure the check to ignore the colon:
subsection.source: <module name="WhitespaceAround"> <property name="ignoreEnhancedForColon" value="false" /> </module>
subsection.p: Example:

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.

subsection.name: Package
subsection.p: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace
